alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Jones (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 5:52PM CDT until May 07 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Fisher County in west central Texas... Western Jones County in west central Texas... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 549 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain ins SYLVESTER with flooding over the roadway... Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. This storm was just north of noodle at 550 PM...moving slowly east at 5 mph. In addition a storm near Merkel will merge with this storm as it moves north to Anson. The expected rainfall rate is 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Anson, Hawley, Noodle, Sylvester, Longworth, The Intersection Of Us-180 And Ranch Road 126, Truby, Stith, Hodges and Funston. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... CO Rd. 444 crossing Noodle Creek and County Road 260 crossing Harmony Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
